intro: Anaphalis sinica var. pernivea, commonly known as silver hair grass, is a perennial herb native to China. It is characterized by its dense, woolly inflorescences that resemble tufts of silver hair, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky areas. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine, silky hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. The flowers are small and inconspicuous, clustered in loose panicles, and bloom in the summer months.
